thread.title: Dog brutally beaten by owner is safe and well and ready to be rehomed - Manchester Evening News
thread.title_full: Dog brutally beaten by owner is safe and well and ready to be rehomed - Manchester Evening News

author: Rebecca Day
title: Dog brutally beaten by owner is safe and well and ready to be rehomed - Manchester Evening News
text:
Dog brutally beaten by owner is safe and well and ready to be rehomed Jamie-Leigh Williams was caught on camera kicking and hitting Lennox in her Oldham home Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Distressing footage: Horrific attack on dog Share this video Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A pooch who was brutally beaten up by his pregnant owner is now a ‘beautiful, friendly dog’ who is getting ready to be rehomed. 
Lennox, who is currently in the care of the RSPCA , is reserved for adoption after suffering at the hand’s of his previous owner. 
The dog is now safely away from Jamie-Leigh Williams, who pleaded guilty on Wednesday, after she was caught on camera kicking and hitting the animal in her Oldham home . Jamie-Leigh Williams 
The footage, which was posted on Facebook back by a former lodger in November, shows the 20-year-old with her back to the camera kick Lennox multiple times as he is trapped against the front door. 
She then punches him twice. Williams is then filmed repeatedly hitting him in the kitchen and smacking him in the face. Read More Pregnant woman caught on camera battering dog walks free after saying it tried to savage her stomach 
RSPCA inspector Natalie Avery said: “I was alerted to Lennox’s plight after footage was posted online that morning and people started to message us on our social media accounts. Lennox has been described as 'beautiful and friendly' and is doing well after video footage emerged of him being brutally beaten 
“We didn’t know where he was and of course were extremely concerned for his welfare after what we’d seen, but by the afternoon, thanks to our tenacious staff and the help of the public and police, we had found him and Williams had signed him over to us. We’re really grateful to everyone who got in touch. 
“At no point during what’s happening to him does Lennox show any aggression towards Williams, he’s crying out and trying to get away. It’s shocking footage. It’s really horrible to watch.” 
When Lennox was checked over by vets, he was luckily found to be uninjured. Read More Lodger left homeless after confronting landlady for viciously beating defenceless dog 
Insp Avery added: “Lennox is still in RSPCA care at the moment where the people looking after him describe him as a beautiful friendly dog, who just wants to be with you, he is reserved for adoption and we hope to have him in a great new home soon.” 
Williams pleaded guilty to causing unnecessary suffering to Lennox by kicking and/or hitting him at Tameside Magistrates’ Court on Wednesday. 
In mitigation, the court heard that Lennox was brought into the home by an abusive boyfriend, and that Williams was scared of the dog. 
The 20-year-old, of Spring Street, Oldham, has been disqualified from keeping animals for five years and was sentenced to a one year community order including 150 hours of unpaid work and ordered to pay £385 costs. Read More
